question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
 & & y & + & 3z & = & 2 \\
x &  &  & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,\frac{y}{2}\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,-2,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:
Consider the vectors $u=(1, 3, 2)$, $v=(-1, 1, 2)$ and $w=(0, 1, 1)$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$ and the scalar triple product $u\cdot (v\times w)$. 
Choose the correct answer.
answer1: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 0$ and the vector $v \times w$ is normal to the vector $u$.
answer2: $u\cdot (v\times w) = (-1, 1, 1)$ and $u \times v$ and $w$ are coplanar vectors.
answer3: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 0$ and $u \times v$ and $w$ are coplanar vectors.
answer4: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 1$ and the vector $v \times w$ is normal to vector $u$.

question:
Discuss the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
3x & + & 2y & - & z & + & 2t & = & 1\\
x & - & y & + &2 z & - & 4t & = & -1\\
-x & - & 2y & - & z & + & t & = & 0\\
2x & + & 3y & - & 2z & + & t & = & 2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has a unique solution.
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.

answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator.

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x &+ &y &- &z &= &1 \\ 
x &+ &y &+ &z &= &2 \\ 
x &- &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1,0,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,0,1\right)$ and $\left(1,0,-1\right)$ as its solutions.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,0,x\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 2 \\ 
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\ 
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(\frac{1}{3}+\frac{5}{3}z,\,\frac{4}{3}+\frac{2}{3}z,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has two solutions: $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ and $\left(0,\,2,\,-1\right)$.

answer2: The system has $\left(2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.

Consider the linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ defined by $T(x,y)= \left(x+y,2x-y,3y\right)$ and the basis $A=\left\{(1,1),(-1,2)\right\}$ and $B=\left\{(0,0,1),(0,2,0),(3,0,0)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^2$ and $\mathbb{R}^3$, respectively. 
Indicate the transformation matrix $T$ relative to the basis $A$ and $B$.

Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	

If a new contraint $2x_{1}+x_{2}+x_{3}\leq 40 $ is included, determine the solution based on the final complete simplex tableau.
Find the conditional extrema of the function $f(x,y)=x^2+y^2-x-y$ having the constraint $x+y=1.$
answer1: The problem has the minimizer $\left(\frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{2}\right),$ the minimum value of the function being $-\frac{1}{2}.$
answer2: There are two minimizers $\left(\frac{1}{4}, \frac{3}{4}\right)$ and $\left(\frac{3}{4},\frac{1}{4}\right)$ where the minimum value of the function is $-\frac{3}{8}.$
answer3: There are two maximizers $\left(\frac{2}{5}, \frac{3}{5}\right)$ and $\left(\frac{3}{5},\frac{2}{5}\right)$ where the maximum value of the function is $-\frac{12}{25}.$
answer4: The problem has no extrema corresponding to this constraint.

Consider the vectors $u=(1, 3, 2)$, $v=(-1, 1, 2)$ and $w=(0, 1, 1)$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$ and the scalar triple product $u\cdot (v\times w)$. 
Choose the correct answer.
answer1: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 0$ and the vector $v \times w$ is normal to the vector $u$.
answer2: $u\cdot (v\times w) = (-1, 1, 1)$ and $u \times v$ and $w$ are coplanar vectors.
answer3: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 0$ and $u \times v$ and $w$ are coplanar vectors.
answer4: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 1$ and the vector $v \times w$ is normal to vector $u$.

question:
Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

question: Choose the true statement.
